column5: Hi guys, new to here. I remember couple of weeks ago I saw a great report, a pro went to a lake and got some really nice gar pikes and crappies. I am pretty sure I saw his face on the outofdoorontario magazine. But I can't find the thread here? And a stupid question, where to fish the beautiful gar? Are they available at south Ontario? Thanks a lot!
The hottest still water backbay you can find, lol.   I dunno why but they LOVE that type of water.
Have seen lots at these: percy boom lake erie coves / shorelines collingwood bays and harbour detroit r
last year we literally saw hundreds in south gorgian bay......always in groups of 6 to bout 10.....would follow our lures to the boat but never taken....this year tho havent seen any in the same area
Thanks a lot! Let me google these spots first, lol
I've seen them in the Indian River, south of Warsaw Caves Conservation Area. Nice river for a quiet canoe paddle, catching some gar would be a bonus!

Stoco Lake in Tweed.  Seen tons in the weeds (the kind that look like reeds that stick out of the water) on the side of the lake directly opposite of the town of Tweed.  I have seen them there the 2 times I have fished on the lake 8 years apart (Once in 2001 and again in 2009), so it seems like that is their home.
X2 I fished there in the 80's , never seen so many gar in my life
